name: Tooltip.Root

openDelay.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to delay opening the tooltip when hovering over the trigger.
openDelay.description_zh: The amount of time in milliseconds to delay opening the tooltip when hovering over the trigger.

closeDelay.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to delay closing the tooltip when the mouse leaves the trigger.
closeDelay.description_zh: The amount of time in milliseconds to delay closing the tooltip when the mouse leaves the trigger.

closeOnEscape.description: Whether or not to close the tooltip when pressing the escape key.
closeOnEscape.description_zh: Whether or not to close the tooltip when pressing the escape key.

closeOnPointerDown.description: Whether or not to close the tooltip when clicking outside of the tooltip.
closeOnPointerDown.description_zh: Whether or not to close the tooltip when clicking outside of the tooltip.

disableHoverableContent.description: Whether or not to disable the hoverable content. This is useful when the content contains interactive elements.
disableHoverableContent.description_zh: Whether or not to disable the hoverable content. This is useful when the content contains interactive elements.

group.description: The group the tooltip belongs to.
group.description_zh: The group the tooltip belongs to.

open.description: The open state of the tooltip component.
open.description_zh: The open state of the tooltip component.

onOpenChange.description: A callback that fires when the open state changes.
onOpenChange.description_zh: A callback that fires when the open state changes.

portal.description: Where to render the tooltip when it is open. Defaults to the body. Can be disabled by passing null
portal.description_zh: Where to render the tooltip when it is open. Defaults to the body. Can be disabled by passing null

description: The root component containing the parts of the tooltip.

slots.name: ids
slots.description: The ids of the elements within the component, useful when you don't necessarily want to provide a custom ID, but still want access to the ID being assigned (if any).
slots.description_zh: The ids of the elements within the component, useful when you don't necessarily want to provide a custom ID, but still want access to the ID being assigned (if any).
